titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Winterhouse Art and Design Collection of Ezra Winter
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Melissa Quinones

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 23:00

did.unittitle: Winterhouse Art and Design Collection of Ezra Winter
did.abstract: The collection contains published as well as archival materials relating to the life and works of Ezra Winter (1886-1949). The collection reflects research undertaken by Jessica Helfand for the "Ezra Winter Project," a visual biography of Ezra Winter published online in 12 parts with Design Observer, the leading international graphic design blog of which Helfand is a founding editor.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection maintains the original order imposed by the collector(s).

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Jessica Helfand and William Drenttel, 2012.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to Yale University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Winterhouse Art and Design Collection of Ezra Winter, Robert B. Haas Family Arts Library, Yale University.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Ezra Augustus Winter (1886-1949) was an American painter, illustrator, and muralist. He was born in Manistee, Michigan, and died in Falls Village, Litchfield County, Connecticut.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains published as well as archival materials relating to the life and works of Ezra Winter (1886-1949). The collection reflects research undertaken by Jessica Helfand for the "Ezra Winter Project," a visual biography of Ezra Winter published online in 12 parts with Design Observer, the leading international graphic design blog of which Helfand is a founding editor.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three series: I. Books, 1901-2011. II. Periodicals, 1911-2011. III. Miscellaneous Research Materials, 1913-2010.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged according to the inventory provided by the collector(s).
